author: radekkapka
content:
I am not sure if this is the correct channel for this question, but how do I specify the `count` parameter in Kurtosis within the `participants_matrix`? The following doesn't compile:
```
participants_matrix:
  el:
    - el_type: geth
      el_image: ethereum/client-go:v1.14.12
  cl:
    - cl_type: prysm
      cl_image: gcr.io/prylabs-dev/prysm/beacon-chain:single-att
      count: 4
      vc_image: ethpandaops/prysm-validator:single-att
```

```
There was an error interpreting Starlark code 
Evaluation error: fail: Invalid parameter count for cl. Allowed fields: ["cl_type", "cl_image", "cl_log_level", "cl_extra_env_vars", "cl_extra_labels", "cl_extra_params", "cl_tolerations", "cl_volume_size", "cl_min_cpu", "cl_max_cpu", "cl_min_mem", "cl_max_mem", "use_separate_vc", "vc_type", "vc_image", "vc_count", "vc_log_level", "vc_extra_env_vars", "vc_extra_labels", "vc_extra_params", "vc_tolerations", "vc_min_cpu", "vc_max_cpu", "vc_min_mem", "vc_max_mem", "validator_count"]
```

author: radekkapka
content: Do I have to switch to use `participants` instead of the matrix?

author: parithosh
content: exactly ðŸ˜„

author: parithosh
content: matrix is just "give me one of each combo listed here"

author: radekkapka
content: oh ok

author: radekkapka
content: the doc is a bit misleading then

author: radekkapka
content:
> Participants matrix creates a participant for each combination of EL, CL and VC clients
> Each EL/CL/VC item can provide the same parameters as a standard participant

author: parithosh
content: ah that's fair, we'll fix that!

author: barnabasbusa
content: count should work there too so probably a sanity check bug

author: barnabasbusa
content: here is a fix: https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/pull/835

author: pawandhananjay
content: Is mekong equal client distribution?

author: parithosh
content:
nope, it should follow this:
```
cl_split = {
    'prysm': 0.25,
    'lighthouse': 0.25,
    'teku': 0.20,
    'lodestar': 0.10,
    'nimbus': 0.10,
    'grandine': 0.10
}


el_split = {
    'geth': 0.50,
    'nethermind': 0.25,
    'ethereumjs': 0.01,
    'reth': 0.08,
    'besu': 0.08,
    'erigon': 0.07,
    'nimbusel': 0.01,
}
```

author: pk910
content:
This kurtosis config easily triggers the current chain split we see on mekong at epoch 4:
```
participants_matrix:
  el:
    - el_type: geth
      el_image: ethpandaops/geth:lightclient-prague-devnet-4-37035c5
  cl:
    - cl_type: teku
      cl_image: consensys/teku:24.10.3
    - cl_type: prysm
      cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:develop-4aa5410
      vc_image: ethpandaops/prysm-validator:develop-4aa5410
    - cl_type: lighthouse
      cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:electra-alpha7-da953b8
    - cl_type: nimbus
      cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:4JM-25aae76
network_params:
  electra_fork_epoch: 1
  min_validator_withdrawability_delay: 1
  shard_committee_period: 1
  churn_limit_quotient: 16
  num_validator_keys_per_node: 128
  seconds_per_slot: 12
additional_services:
  - dora
  - apache
  - assertoor
dora_params:
  image: "ethpandaops/dora:master"
snooper_enabled: true
assertoor_params:
  run_stability_check: false
  run_block_proposal_check: false
  tests:
    - { file: "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ethpandaops/assertoor/refs/heads/electra-support/playbooks/pectra-dev/kurtosis/eip6110-double-deposit.yaml"}
```

nimbus & grandine seem to be the only clients processing these deposits correctly and following the right chain.
